body.p: “The apple bloom is chiefly passed. Rubus sempervirence put for leaf soon after R. Canadensis Is that the O. Cinnamomea? at the dwarf sumachs (which ap flowers with the Hill one) its fertil fronds without leaves & its curved white rfoots or bases regularly feather marked? The Dwarf sumach is just starting, some of them, decidedly later than the button bush! At Clam shell- the small oblong yellow heads of yel. clover- some days. Tall butter-cup a day or 2 – Dandelions for some time gone to seed. Water saxifrage now well out. As I started away from Clam shell – It was quite warm-the seats- & the water glassy smooth- but a little wind rose afterward.”
